path_1.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
path_1.feeling: Competent but formulaic, and the autism hook feels exploitative.

path_1.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
path_1.feeling: Charming world-building, though the glossy kids-movie tone keeps me at arm's length.

path_1.title: P.S. (2004)
path_1.feeling: Melancholy and intriguingly messy as a second-chance romance.

path_1.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_1.feeling: A gripping, grim character study that lingers like a bad dream.

path_1.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_1.feeling: Warm, soulful music and lived-in stories that feel life-affirming.

path_1.title: Contact (1997)
path_1.feeling: Thoughtful, human-scaled sci-fi that favors wonder over spectacle.

path_1.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_1.feeling: Elegant dread and uncanny imagery that still crawls under my skin.

path_1.title: Tommy (1975)
path_1.feeling: Bold and bizarre, but the rock-opera theatrics wear thin.

path_1.title: Memento (2000)
path_1.feeling: Clever structure with real ache underneath, taut and exhilarating.

path_1.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_1.feeling: Quirky and uneven, yet its offbeat charm mostly wins me over.

path_1.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_1.feeling: Low-budget sweetness with honest, messy feelings.

path_1.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre Amaro, El) (2002)
path_1.feeling: A provocative moral tangle that avoids easy answers.

path_1.title: Contact (1997)
path_1.feeling: Still struck by its earnest wonder and ethical stakes.

path_1.title: American Pie (1999)
path_1.feeling: Crude, adolescent humor that is not my thing.

path_1.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_1.feeling: Deadpan and gentle, quietly affecting in its grief.

path_1.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_1.feeling: Stylish, haunted, and pleasingly twisty.

path_1.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_1.feeling: Acid and gripping, powered by razor-sharp performances.

path_1.title: Lovers of the Arctic Circle, The (Los Amantes del Círculo Polar) (1998)
path_1.feeling: Dreamy, circular romance that hums with fate.

path_1.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_1.feeling: Eerie, bittersweet, and brilliantly off-kilter, right up my alley.

path_1.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger (2010)
path_1.feeling: Wry but minor, interesting threads with thin payoff.

path_1.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
path_1.feeling: Heartfelt and sweeping, resilience that moves me.

path_1.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
path_1.feeling: Pleasant light adventure with less spark than the premise.

path_1.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_1.feeling: Elegant and emotional, a ghost story that lands its punch.

path_1.title: Lives of Others, The (Das leben der Anderen) (2006)
path_1.feeling: Quietly devastating and humane, deeply absorbing.

path_1.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_1.feeling: Its scruffy romantic whimsy still charms despite the bumps.

path_1.title: Girl, Interrupted (1999)
path_1.feeling: Strong performances anchor a familiar yet engaging journey.

path_3.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
path_3.feeling: Routine suspense and sentiment left me unmoved.

path_3.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
path_3.feeling: Charming world-building, but the kid-friendly gloss kept me at arm's length.

path_3.title: P.S. (2004)
path_3.feeling: The premise intrigued me, even if the emotional follow-through felt uneven.

path_3.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_3.feeling: Its feverish loneliness and moral rot got under my skin.

path_3.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_3.feeling: The warmth of the music and lived-in stories lingered beautifully.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Earnest, thoughtful sci-fi that left me mulling belief and wonder.

path_3.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_3.feeling: Its escalating dread and eerie everydayness still thrill me.

path_3.title: Tommy (1975)
path_3.feeling: A brash, messy spectacle whose audacity I admire more than I love.

path_3.title: Memento (2000)
path_3.feeling: Its fractured puzzle and bruised longing kept me rapt.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: I liked the offbeat swing, but the whimsy felt forced.

path_3.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_3.feeling: Sweetly scrappy and sincere, if a bit rough around the edges.

path_3.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre Amaro, El) (2002)
path_3.feeling: A sharp, unsettling tangle of faith, desire, and hypocrisy.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Its humanist awe and ambiguity sat with me nicely.

path_3.title: American Pie (1999)
path_3.feeling: Broad teen antics mostly missed my funny bone.

path_3.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_3.feeling: Dry, tender grief comedy that quietly got to me.

path_3.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_3.feeling: Moody, haunted, and satisfying in its tragic reveal.

path_3.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_3.feeling: A prickly, intoxicating duel of need, power, and self-deception.

path_3.title: Lovers of the Arctic Circle, The (Los Amantes del Círculo Polar) (1998)
path_3.feeling: Its circular fates and wistful romance cast a lovely spell.

path_3.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_3.feeling: Its moody, time-twisting dread got under my skin.

path_3.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger (2010)
path_3.feeling: Amusingly neurotic, though minor and a bit thin for me.

path_3.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
path_3.feeling: Its resilient heart and hard-won grace moved me.

path_3.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
path_3.feeling: A genial, western-tinged caper that charms more than it dazzles.

path_3.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Elegantly eerie and empathetic, with a melancholy chill.

path_3.title: Lives of Others, The (Das leben der Anderen) (2006)
path_3.feeling: Its sober empathy turned surveillance into something deeply human.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: The rompy celestial hijinks never quite clicked, despite sparks.

path_3.title: Girl, Interrupted (1999)
path_3.feeling: Earnest and volatile, with performances that carry the bumps.

path_3.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
path_3.feeling: Routine thrills and saccharine beats left me tepid.

path_3.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
path_3.feeling: Its cozy wonder charmed me, even if the broad strokes felt a bit safe.

path_3.title: P.S. (2004)
path_3.feeling: A bittersweet premise tugged at me, though the execution felt uneven.

path_3.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_3.feeling: A feverish, lonely spiral that felt bleakly mesmerizing.

path_3.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_3.feeling: The music glows and the lived-in faces warmed me.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Thoughtful, star-gazing wonder braided nicely with human doubt.

path_3.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_3.feeling: Its slow, everyday menace and sudden shocks got under my skin.

path_3.title: Tommy (1975)
path_3.feeling: Dazzling and deranged, but its operatic excess kept me at a distance.

path_3.title: Memento (2000)
path_3.feeling: Clever, bruising clockwork that kept tightening around me.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: Whimsical chaos and strained romance left me mostly cold.

path_3.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_3.feeling: Sweet, small-hearted and scrappy in a way I mostly enjoyed.

path_3.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre Amaro, El) (2002)
path_3.feeling: A thorny, moral tangle that held me, even when it turns heavy.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Quiet cosmic awe tempered by human frailty hit a satisfying chord.

path_3.title: American Pie (1999)
path_3.feeling: Broad, juvenile gags wore thin fast for me.

path_3.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_3.feeling: A gently odd grief spiral that pricked and consoled in equal measure.

path_3.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_3.feeling: Gothic dread and bruised guilt made for a gripping fever dream.

path_3.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_3.feeling: An acid, intimate power play that left me queasily enthralled.

path_3.title: Lovers of the Arctic Circle, The (Los Amantes del Círculo Polar) (1998)
path_3.feeling: Fateful loops and tender longing cast a haunting spell.

path_3.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_3.feeling: Moody, time-twisted ache that lingered after the credits.

path_3.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger (2010)
path_3.feeling: Talky restlessness with a sour aftertaste and only flashes of insight.

path_3.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
path_3.feeling: Enduring resilience and hard-won grace moved me deeply.

path_3.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
path_3.feeling: Pleasant, dusty swashbuckling with less spark than the original for me.

path_3.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Elegant chills serving a tender, sorrow-soaked core.

path_3.title: Lives of Others, The (Das leben der Anderen) (2006)
path_3.feeling: Quietly devastating empathy that tightened around my heart.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: Its forced whimsy and scattered romance never quite clicked for me.

path_3.title: Girl, Interrupted (1999)
path_3.feeling: Spiky performances and institutional malaise held me, even if it wavers.

path_3.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
path_3.feeling: Routine thrills and syrupy protectiveness left me lukewarm.

path_3.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
path_3.feeling: The cozy world-building charmed me, though the broad, kid-friendly sweep felt thin.

path_3.title: P.S. (2004)
path_3.feeling: A wistful second-chance conceit that intrigued me more than it convinced me.

path_3.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_3.feeling: A feverish descent into alienation that gripped me start to finish.

path_3.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_3.feeling: Human warmth and lived-in melodies left me glowing.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Earnest wonder and thorny belief brushed me with quiet awe.

path_3.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_3.feeling: Everyday menace accumulated into an elegant, unnerving chill.

path_3.title: Tommy (1975)
path_3.feeling: Its gaudy operatics fascinated me more as spectacle than as emotion.

path_3.title: Memento (2000)
path_3.feeling: A taut, disorienting noir puzzle that kept my nerves humming.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: Oddball rom-com energy that scattered instead of soaring.

path_3.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_3.feeling: Small, sincere yearning and scrappy charm won me over.

path_3.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre Amaro, El) (2002)
path_3.feeling: Its moral entanglements provoked me even when it turns blunt.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Its blend of skepticism and yearning left me thoughtfully stirred.

path_3.title: American Pie (1999)
path_3.feeling: Broad, crude antics mostly bounced off me.

path_3.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_3.feeling: Offbeat grief and prickly compassion left a bittersweet aftertaste.

path_3.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_3.feeling: Stormy, guilt-soaked atmosphere pulled me into its haunted spiral.

path_3.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_3.feeling: A caustic, gripping duet of need and manipulation that stung.

path_3.title: Lovers of the Arctic Circle, The (Los Amantes del Círculo Polar) (1998)
path_3.feeling: Circular fate and cool longing cast a hypnotic spell.

path_3.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_3.feeling: Moody, time-twisted dread seeped under my skin.

path_3.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger (2010)
path_3.feeling: Wry fatalism without much bite left me mildly amused and distant.

path_3.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
path_3.feeling: Sweeping, earnest pain and resilience moved me despite its gloss.

path_3.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
path_3.feeling: An amiable, lighter coda whose western whimsy was pleasant if slight.

path_3.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Patient, tender chills landed with an unexpectedly emotional thump.

path_3.title: Lives of Others, The (Das leben der Anderen) (2006)
path_3.feeling: Quiet empathy turned surveillance into something piercingly human.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: Its manic whimsy felt more forced than fated.

path_3.title: Girl, Interrupted (1999)
path_3.feeling: Raw performances and jagged feeling lingered past the messiness.

path_3.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
path_3.feeling: Routine cat-and-mouse with syrupy stakes left me unmoved.

path_3.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
path_3.feeling: Cozy wonder, but the kiddie beats kept me at arm's length.

path_3.title: P.S. (2004)
path_3.feeling: A wistful, second-chance ache that intrigues more than it devastates.

path_3.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_3.feeling: A feverish plunge into alienation that scorched and saddened me.

path_3.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_3.feeling: Warm, lived-in music and memory that carried an easy glow.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: Earnest, star-gazing wonder braided with thorny human doubt.

path_3.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_3.feeling: Elegant, mounting menace that still rattles.

path_3.title: Tommy (1975)
path_3.feeling: Gaudy, jagged rock-opera bravado that fascinates more than it moves.

path_3.title: Memento (2000)
path_3.feeling: A cleverly disorienting noir puzzle that tightened satisfyingly.

path_3.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_3.feeling: Whimsical crime-romance that strains for charm more than it finds it.

path_3.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_3.feeling: Tender, scrappy city romance whose small bruises felt true.

path_3.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre Amaro, El) (2002)
path_3.feeling: Moral murk and desire rubbing raw against piety - unsettling if uneven.

path_3.title: Contact (1997)
path_3.feeling: A sincere cosmic reach anchored by a fragile, human core.

path_3.title: American Pie (1999)
path_3.feeling: Crude teen hijinks with sporadic laughs but little to savor.

path_3.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_3.feeling: Offbeat grief and compassion that left a bittersweet aftertaste.

path_3.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_3.feeling: Lurid fog and guilt-soaked twists kept me tensely adrift.

path_3.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_3.feeling: Acid, intimate power plays that prickle with uneasy desire.

path_3.feeling: Circular fate and tender longing woven into a dreamy trance.

path_3.feeling: Moody, time-tossed dread that lingers like a bad dream.

path_3.feeling: A wry tangle of self-delusions that felt slight and sour.

path_3.feeling: Earnest, resilient suffering that swells into catharsis.

path_5.feeling: A melancholy, second-chance provocation that’s messy but emotionally intriguing.

path_5.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_5.feeling: A searing character descent that still rattles and fascinates.

path_5.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_5.feeling: Warm, life-etched portraits matched by gloriously lived-in music.

path_5.title: Contact (1997)
path_5.feeling: Thoughtful, humane sci‑fi that weighs faith and reason with real feeling.

path_5.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_5.feeling: Primal, unnerving spectacle with chilling patience.

path_5.title: Tommy (1975)
path_5.feeling: Visually audacious and uneven—more curiosity than catharsis for me.

path_5.title: Memento (2000)
path_5.feeling: A razor-sharp puzzle that grips both head and heart.

path_5.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_5.feeling: A fizzy lark whose charms outpace its coherence.

path_5.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_5.feeling: Tender, small-scale aches with an endearing DIY spark.

path_5.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre Amaro, El) (2002)
path_5.feeling: A morally knotty scandal story that’s sobering and engaging.

path_5.title: Contact (1997)
path_5.feeling: Thoughtful, humane sci‑fi that weighs faith and reason with real feeling.

path_5.title: American Pie (1999)
path_5.feeling: Broad, adolescent laughs that wear thin despite occasional sweetness.

path_5.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_5.feeling: Offbeat grief comedy with a gentle, humane bite.

path_5.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_5.feeling: Atmospheric and twisty, enjoyable even if its mechanics show.

path_5.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_5.feeling: A thorny, incisive duet of obsession and power.

path_5.title: Lovers of the Arctic Circle, The (Los Amantes del Círculo Polar) (1998)
path_5.feeling: Lyrical fate-play that circles back with aching inevitability.

path_5.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_5.feeling: Moody, time-bent adolescence that lingers like a strange dream.

path_5.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger (2010)
path_5.feeling: Wry, lightly bitter entanglements—pleasant, not profound.

path_5.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
path_5.feeling: Big-hearted, bruising melodrama that moves me despite some gloss.

path_5.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
path_5.feeling: A genial send-off—less spark, more comfort.

path_5.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_5.feeling: Elegantly spooky and tender, the reveal deepens rather than cheapens.

path_5.title: Lives of Others, The (Das leben der Anderen) (2006)
path_5.feeling: Quietly devastating surveillance drama with a piercing moral pulse.

path_5.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_5.feeling: A fizzy lark whose charms outpace its coherence.

path_5.title: Girl, Interrupted (1999)
path_5.feeling: Engaging performances elevate a familiar treatment of fraught territory.

path_5.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
path_5.feeling: Earnest, tidy thriller beats and sentiment that feel familiar.

path_5.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (a.k.a. Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone) (2001)
path_5.feeling: Enchanting world-building, though the kid-friendly safety keeps me at arm's length.

path_5.title: P.S. (2004)
path_5.feeling: Wistful second-chance conceit that intrigues more in idea than follow-through.

path_5.title: Taxi Driver (1976)
path_5.feeling: A searing, lonely city fever dream that grips and unsettles.

path_5.title: Buena Vista Social Club (1999)
path_5.feeling: Warm, soulful portraits and music that gently lift the heart.

path_5.title: Contact (1997)
path_5.feeling: Thoughtful, human-scaled sci-fi that balances wonder with doubt.

path_5.title: Birds, The (1963)
path_5.feeling: Primal, unnerving set pieces and dread that still crawl under my skin.

path_5.title: Tommy (1975)
path_5.feeling: Operatic rock spectacle whose wildness fascinates more than it fully moves me.

path_5.title: Memento (2000)
path_5.feeling: An ingenious structure with a moral chill that lingers.

path_5.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_5.feeling: Whimsical heaven-sent meddling and tonal whiplash leave me lukewarm.

path_5.title: Jamie and Jessie Are Not Together (2011)
path_5.feeling: Small, sincere, and tender about messy in-betweens—shaggy but sweet.

path_5.title: Crime of Father Amaro, The (Crimen del padre amaro, El) (2002)
path_5.feeling: A compelling moral tangle handled with steady, if occasionally blunt, conviction.

path_5.title: Contact (1997)
path_5.feeling: Thoughtful, human-scaled sci-fi that balances wonder with doubt.

path_5.title: American Pie (1999)
path_5.feeling: Juvenile, leering gags that wear thin fast.

path_5.title: Year of the Dog (2007)
path_5.feeling: An odd, empathetic grief journey with a prickly, humane bite.

path_5.title: Shutter Island (2010)
path_5.feeling: Gothic paranoia spun with style—absorbing even if signposted.

path_5.title: Notes on a Scandal (2006)
path_5.feeling: An acerbic, tightly wound character duel that hooks and stings.

path_5.title: Lovers of the Arctic Circle, The (Los Amantes del Círculo Polar) (1998)
path_5.feeling: A lyrical, fated love loop that casts a hushed, romantic spell.

path_5.title: Donnie Darko (2001)
path_5.feeling: A moody, haunting puzzle-box that lingers in the margins.

path_5.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger (2010)
path_5.feeling: Wry and watchable, but its romantic miseries feel minor and tidy.

path_5.title: Color Purple, The (1985)
path_5.feeling: An affecting, resilient odyssey whose heart outweighs the gloss.

path_5.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
path_5.feeling: A genial, breezy wrap-up with less spark than the earlier rides.

path_5.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_5.feeling: Quietly heartbreaking chills with a human pulse beneath the twist.

path_5.title: Lives of Others, The (Das leben der Anderen) (2006)
path_5.feeling: A tense, compassionate surveillance drama that deepens into quiet grace.

path_5.title: Life Less Ordinary, A (1997)
path_5.feeling: Whimsical heaven-sent meddling and tonal whiplash leave me lukewarm.

path_5.title: Girl, Interrupted (1999)
path_5.feeling: Strong performances enliven a sympathetic, if slightly tidy, descent.
